channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bent lampost outside 14 curlew close, 8th July
item.description:
This has been leaning a lot for months and is loose at the base which is dangerous and safety risk.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Curlew Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bed frame +, 8th July
item.description:
Two ladies in traditional African dress dumped a bedframe, mattress and bedding in Lenton Path, against a house wall. They said that they would remove it but just moved it a few yards to a garden wall then ran away.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tuam Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Honiton Road, 7th July
item.description:
The whole of Honiton Road and both sides of the junction of this street with Hartland Road have not been cleaned for so long that leaves are blocking drains, as they mix with the dirt and other detritus left uncleaned. Not only it is very dirty and detrimental to the inhabitants and visitors of the street but it is also creating serious hazards and flooding issues as illustrated by the pictures taken after a recent rain episode. In addition, when so many leaves eventually make their way into the main rain collectors, it can clog them up, build up inside pressure and cause serious damage to the system, triggering costly repairs to the council tax payers. Please do act immediately to remedy the situation and remove all leaves and detritus of the street. Thank you.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Honiton Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement drain cover leaking, 7th July
item.description:
This has been an issue for at least two weeks on Leysdown Avenue, outside number 29. The water is pooling on the pavement and down the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leysdown Avenue, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large black bin liner filled with rubbish at top of Furzefield Road, 7th July
item.description:
There had been bags of rubbish in the same area which have been removed, but there is now another large bin bag of rubbish placed there late Monday evening. Could you please remove as foxes ripped open the original bags in the early hours of the morning scattering debris all over the pavement
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58, Craigerne Road, Kidbrooke, London

item.title: Debris, discarded furniture and rubbish in front of door. Some frim a week ago., 7th July
item.description:
After making a report yesterday, some debris has been cleared though there is new builder waste, black bags and other rubbish. PLEASE START FINING PEOPLE. WHY DO WE HAVE TO LIVE WITH CONSTANT FLYTIPPING EITH NO CONSEQUENCES?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rouel Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light pollution from new garage lighting, 7th July
item.description:
Four extremely bright floodlight-style fittings have recently been installed at the rear of our property, facing directly into our windows. They are on 24/7, with no shielding or directional control, and shine straight into our bedroom and study, making it feel like daylight at night. This is causing significant disturbance and will be worse in winter. These are not standard street lights - they appear more like garage/floodlights and are inappropriately positioned for a residential area. We urgently request that the council reassess their necessity, brightness, angle, and operating hours, and install shields, dimmers, or timers as appropriate.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gibbon Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More or less where indicated, 7th July
item.description:
I reported this big pothole previously under ref 7679506. I was told it was not serious enough for immediate repair and would be re-inspected 14 days later. I don't think it was re-inspected and I believe the first assessment to have been a mistake; it's a big pothole. Please could you ask the guys to have another look and double check they have the right location. Photo already supplied Thank you
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Chatsworth Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rye Lane, Peckham, London

item.title: Excessively bright lighting, 7th July
item.description:
Excessively bright security lighting has been installed along the garages close to the rear of our house. I understand the need for security lighting but this is causing distress and preventing adequate sleep for my household as it has excessively lit up the bedrooms and the living space. 4 months ago, we put up blackout blinds to initially mitigate the issue but more have now been installed and it is an unacceptable amount of white light to be shining into a house.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Selden Road, New Cross Gate, London
Report on FixMyStreet
